TITLE: Sam Bankman-Fried and FTX Engaged in Fraud for Years, Prosecutors Say
SUMMARY: A criminal indictment unsealed on Tuesday and a complaint by the S.E.C. describe years of wrongdoing in Sam Bankman-Fried’s crypto empire.

TITLE: Musk Shakes Up Twitter’s Legal Team as He Looks to Cut More Costs
SUMMARY: Twitter has stopped paying rent on offices and is considering not paying severance packages to former employees, among other measures.

TITLE: FTX’s Sam Bankman-Fried Denied Bail by Judge in the Bahamas
SUMMARY: The chief magistrate said Mr. Bankman-Fried’s access to financial resources made his risk of fleeing “so great” that he had to remain behind bars.

TITLE: Damian Williams, Prosecutor in the FTX Case, Tackles Major Financial Crimes
SUMMARY: “I think it’s fair to say,” the federal prosecutor, Damian Williams, said of the Samuel Bankman-Fried case, “that by anyone’s lights, this is one of the biggest financial frauds in American history.”

TITLE: Lloyd Newman, Teenage Chronicler of ‘Ghetto Life,’ Dies at 43
SUMMARY: He and LeAlan Jones recorded stories of life and death in a Chicago housing project for NPR, winning a Peabody Award and inspiring the birth of StoryCorps.

TITLE: German Tax Schemer Hanno Berger Sentenced to Eight Years in Prison
SUMMARY: Hanno Berger, a former lawyer and tax adviser, was at the center of a scandal that cost Germany nearly $300 million.

TITLE: Stocks Edge Higher as Investors Welcome Signs of Cooling Inflation
SUMMARY: Wall Street is expecting the Federal Reserve to slow down its interest rate increases, but the central bank’s meeting on Wednesday offers investors a reason to be cautious.

TITLE: Inflation Cooled Notably in November, Good News for the Fed
SUMMARY: Consumer Price Index data reinforces that inflation is beginning to slow down just ahead of the Federal Reserve’s December rate decision.

TITLE: Sam Bankman-Fried’s Parents Under Scrutiny in FTX Collapse
SUMMARY: The FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried’s mother and father, who teach at Stanford Law School, are under scrutiny for their connections to their son’s crypto business.

TITLE: Sam Bankman-Fried and Schlubby Style
SUMMARY: Sam Bankman-Fried’s choices may signal an end to the schlubby mystique.

TITLE: In FTX Collapse, Binance Sees a Chance to Become the New Face of Crypto
SUMMARY: Sam Bankman-Fried and Changpeng Zhao were archrivals. With FTX gone, Binance, the world’s biggest crypto exchange, is trying to step into the void.

TITLE: Inflation Forecasts Were Wrong Last Year. Should We Believe Them Now?
SUMMARY: Economists misjudged how much staying power inflation would have. Next year could be better — but there’s ample room for humility.

TITLE: Japan Needs Indian Tech Workers. But Do They Need Japan?
SUMMARY: Recruiters call the push a crucial test of whether the world’s third-largest economy can compete with the U.S. and Europe for global talent.

TITLE: Wall Street Journal Names Emma Tucker as New Editor
SUMMARY: News Corp said that Emma Tucker, a longtime editor in London, would replace Matt Murray, who has led the news organization for four years.

TITLE: Read the Criminal Indictment Against Sam Bankman-Fried
SUMMARY: Federal prosecutors in Manhattan unsealed an eight count indictment against the founder of the collapsed crypto exchange FTX.

TITLE: Black Travelers Say Home-Share Hosts Discriminate, and a New Airbnb Report Agrees
SUMMARY: The internal study details the vacation rental company’s antidiscrimination efforts. But some travelers of color say it and other home-share companies don’t go far enough.

TITLE: Takeaways From November’s CPI Inflation Report
SUMMARY: Core inflation, which strips out volatile food and energy prices, slowed to 6 percent over the year, an indication that price increases are slowing broadly.

TITLE: FTX Founder Sam Bankman-Fried’s “House of Cards” Teeters
SUMMARY: Now under arrest, the fallen crypto mogul faces a barrage of charges, including defrauding investors out of billions.

TITLE: S.E.C. Charges Sam Bankman-Fried With Defrauding FTX Investors
SUMMARY: The founder of the collapsed crypto exchange was accused of “orchestrating a scheme to defraud equity investors” who put more than $1.8 billion into the company.

TITLE: United Airlines Orders 100 Wide-Body Boeing 787 Jets
SUMMARY: United plans to take delivery of the planes over an eight-year span to refresh its fleet and increase fuel efficiency, with an option to buy 100 more.

TITLE: Cheap Meets Eco-Chic on the Ski Slopes
SUMMARY: Alpine gear is expensive, but online dealers of used jackets, boots, skis and more are enticing newcomers with bargain prices and promoting recycling in an era of climate change.

TITLE: Brain Implants Have Begun to Restore Functions, but Advances Are Slow
SUMMARY: But achieving full-body restoration of movement, as Elon Musk envisions with such devices, is considered far into the future, if at all.

TITLE: Sam Bankman-Fried Arrested in the Bahamas After US Prosecutors File Charges
SUMMARY: A statement by the government of the Bahamas said Mr. Bankman-Fried was arrested after prosecutors in the United States filed criminal charges.

TITLE: Supreme Court Refuses to Block California’s Ban on Flavored Tobacco
SUMMARY: The state’s voters had overwhelmingly supported letting a two-year-old law take effect, and lower courts had refused to put it on hold.

TITLE: Elon Musk Takes a Shot at Dr. Anthony Fauci on Twitter
SUMMARY: The Twitter owner has taken shots at targets like Dr. Anthony Fauci, the nation’s chief immunologist, in moves that may appeal to the right, but not advertisers.

TITLE: In China’s New Covid Strategy, Vaccines Matter
SUMMARY: As the government drops its restrictions, it not only needs to convince people that the virus is nothing to fear, but also that inoculations are essential.

TITLE: Taking to the Woods With Maine’s ‘Tree Tippers’
SUMMARY: Generations of Mainers have made a living working seasonal, nature-based jobs. Harvesting the balsam used to make wreaths is one of them.

TITLE: The Fashion Designers Dries Van Noten and Christopher John Rogers in Conversation
SUMMARY: While decades apart in experience, Dries Van Noten and Christopher John Rogers are both known for their creative use of color and holding on to their autonomy.

TITLE: Pouring Through a Crisis: How Budweiser Salvaged Its World Cup
SUMMARY: Taken by surprise by Qatar’s decision to ban beer at stadiums, the company remade its marketing strategy in real time.

TITLE: Pants Recovered From Shipwreck Sell for $114,000 at Auction
SUMMARY: The pants and other artifacts auctioned were salvaged from the S.S. Central America, a ship that sank in 1857.

TITLE: The Week in Business: Labor Actions Sweep Britain
SUMMARY: The national average gasoline price has fallen to where it was a year ago. China’s economy is not expected to bounce back quickly, as it rolls back “zero Covid” policies. And the Fed meets.

TITLE: Why Is Howard Schultz Taking a Starbucks Union So Personally?
SUMMARY: His opposition to a union isn’t primarily about the bottom line, friends say. It clashes with his image of Starbucks as a model employer.

TITLE: Vaping Settlement by Juul Is Said to Total $1.7 Billion
SUMMARY: The proposed deal would resolve thousands of lawsuits in multidistrict litigation based in Northern California.

TITLE: In a Future Filled With Electric Cars, AM Radio May Be Left Behind
SUMMARY: Carmakers say electromagnetic interference causes static and noise on AM transmissions, annoying customers. Broadcasters say they could lose a connection to their core listeners, who rely on the radio for emergencies.

TITLE: To Rein In Big Tech, Europe Looked Beyond Lawsuits. Will the U.S. Follow?
SUMMARY: The largest American banks are classified as “systemically important” and subject to more stringent scrutiny. Some lawmakers want to do the same for Big Tech.

TITLE: In New Mexico, Trying to Capitalize on Natural Beauty as Climate Change Disrupts It
SUMMARY: Climate change is reshaping the American economy. New Mexico is leaning on ecotourism and sustainable industries to see it through, but extreme weather keeps getting in the way.

TITLE: China’s Youths, Stung by Years of Covid Rules, Fear Grim Job Future
SUMMARY: A sluggish economy continues to leave many young people unemployed, with few job prospects or hopes to tap into the rising incomes their parents enjoyed during boom times.

TITLE: What Are the Politics of Elon Musk? It’s Complicated.
SUMMARY: Elon Musk has tweeted about political topics regularly since taking over Twitter, often belittling some liberal causes. But what he stands for remains largely unclear.

TITLE: China’s Looming ‘Tsunami’ of Covid Cases Will Test Its Hospitals
SUMMARY: To conserve resources for the severely ill, the government is urging residents not to seek help unless necessary. But the pivot has left many confused and anxious.

TITLE: How to Become Santa Claus
SUMMARY: Four pros share their tips for making magical Christmas memories.

TITLE: Lina Khan, Aiming to Block Microsoft’s Activision Deal, Faces a Challenge
SUMMARY: Ms. Khan, the chair of the Federal Trade Commission, has staked an ambitious trustbusting agenda on a case that may be difficult to win.

TITLE: Oil Prices Drop, Despite Heightened Sanctions on Russian Crude
SUMMARY: The price of oil fell by about 10 percent this week, easing (for now) supply worries about the E.U. embargo and a price cap.

TITLE: Markets Fluctuate at the End of a Shaky Week
SUMMARY: Persistent pullbacks in recent sessions reflect investors’ worries about stubbornly high inflation.

TITLE: Turkey Is Strengthening Its Energy Ties With Russia
SUMMARY: As Moscow seeks new customers for oil, gas and coal, Ankara is a willing buyer as it promotes plans as a regional trading hub.

TITLE: After a Terrible Year for Bonds, the Outlook Is Better
SUMMARY: October capped their worst 12-month period ever, and the economy is under pressure. Yet the fundamental math of bond returns bodes well for 2023, our columnist says.

TITLE: How Bad Are Microplastics? An Expert Weighs In.
SUMMARY: “We’re becoming aware that they’re everywhere.” An environmental researcher weighs in on the little particles that break away from the everyday plastic items in our lives.

TITLE: A Guide to Signing Up for Health Coverage
SUMMARY: With the deadline near for marketplace medical insurance, a video offers some down-to-earth advice for navigating numerous options and obscure terms.

TITLE: Sam Bankman-Fried Agrees to Testify Before House Committee
SUMMARY: The FTX founder said on Twitter that he will appear before a House committee next week, but was quiet about a similar request from a Senate committee.

TITLE: Workers at E.V. Battery Plant in Ohio Vote to Unionize
SUMMARY: The result, at a plant owned by General Motors and a South Korean company, is a milestone for the auto union in organizing electric vehicle workers.

TITLE: The FTC’s Bet on Rewriting Antitrust by Taking on Microsoft
SUMMARY: In seeking to oppose the $69 billion takeover of Activision Blizzard, the agency is hoping to revamp the nation’s antitrust rules — even if it loses.

TITLE: A Rural Hospital’s Excruciating Choice: $3.2 Million a Year or Inpatient Care?
SUMMARY: A new federal program offers hefty payments to small hospitals at risk of closing. But it comes with a bewildering requirement.

TITLE: Beijing Braces for Covid Surge After China Lifts Pandemic Curbs
SUMMARY: Residents lined up at hospitals and pharmacies, seeking help for fevers and buying at-home tests after the government’s decision to ease its “zero Covid” policy.

TITLE: ‘I Will Keep Fighting’: China’s Protesters Say It’s Bigger Than Covid
SUMMARY: The restrictions that drove people into the streets last month are being rolled back. But many of those who demonstrated say they want more.

TITLE: Qatar Extends Its Natural Gas Dominance at Russia’s Expense
SUMMARY: As its influence grows, the country is poised to become a big energy supplier to Europe, which has turned away from Russia after its invasion of Ukraine.

TITLE: Highbrow Films Aimed at Winning Oscars Are Losing Audiences
SUMMARY: The kind of critically praised dramas that often dominate the awards season are falling flat at the box office, failing to justify the money it takes to make them.

TITLE: Inside the Frantic Texts Exchanged by Crypto Executives as FTX Collapsed
SUMMARY: A group chat including crypto leaders shows Binance’s Changpeng Zhao accusing FTX’s Sam Bankman-Fried of orchestrating trades to destabilize the industry.

TITLE: Biden Devotes $36 Billion to Save Union Workers’ Pensions
SUMMARY: The money comes from last year’s Covid-19 relief package and will avert cuts of up to 60 percent in pensions for 350,000 Teamster truck drivers, warehouse and construction workers and food processors.

TITLE: Meta Battles F.T.C. in Court Over Future of Virtual Reality
SUMMARY: A trial that began Thursday will serve as a test of the Federal Trade Commission’s argument that Facebook’s parent company is trying to buy its way to dominance in the nascent virtual and augmented reality markets.

TITLE: The Villain So Far in ‘Harry & Meghan’? Not the Royal Family.
SUMMARY: Harry and Meghan focused their ire in their Netflix documentary on the tabloids they say have hounded them out of remorseless greed and scarcely concealed racism.
